s1: Cyber Security Foundations introduces all essential cyber security principles.
s2: This course introduces core concepts of data cleaning, standardisation, and data integration, that are aimed at converting and mapping raw data into other formats that allow more efficient and convenient use and analysis of data. The courses also discusses data quality, management, and storage issues as relevant to data analytics.

s1: This includes principles of secure design, secrets minimization, least privilege, isolation, separation and encapsulation.
s2: Justify and apply data cleaning, preprocessing, and standardisation for data analytics.

s1: The interplay between failed security principles and vulnerabilities is investigated in detail.
s2: Understand and be able to use advanced data wrangling, data integration, and database techniques as relevant to data analytics.

s1: The course provides the essential foundations which allow students to continue in a more in-depth cyber security career, yet can also be used a standalone unit to provide a self-contained set of knowledge.

The courses also discusses data quality, management, and storage issues as relevant to data analytics.

s1: Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the fundamental principles underlying Cyber Security.

s1: Define and identify cyber security principles and their violation.
s2: Interpret, assess and discuss data quality measurements.

s2: Apply data integration concepts and techniques to heterogeneous and distributed data.
